content: simple hanger cover materials  approx ½ oz worsted weight yarn i use leftovers  size h hook  yarn needle  plastic hangers in your choice of color abbreviations r round st stitch half_double_crochet half-double_crochet chain chain sts stitches slip_stitch slip_stitch fhdc foundation half_double_crochet find videos for this technique on youtube com to make in the round r1 chain 116 join with a slip_stitch to first chain to form loop being careful not to twist chain half_double_crochet same st as join half_double_crochet each st to end join with a slip_stitch to 1st half_double_crochet not ch1 or leave about a 4 tail then work fhdc for 115 sts join being careful not to twist use the tail to sew the bottom closed note the fhdc will also count as r1 & r2 115 sts r2 ch1 do not count half_double_crochet same st half_double_crochet in each st to end join with a slip_stitch to first half_double_crochet not ch1 r3 ch1 do not count half_double_crochet same st half_double_crochet each st to end join with a slip_stitch to first half_double_crochet not ch1 cut yarn leaving a long tail for sewing on hanger i measure twice the length of the cover assembly insert hook of hanger between two stitches close to the join fold cover over hanger and stitch closed on the inside of the hanger using whatever method you prefer i use whip stitch fasten_off and weave end to make flat r1 chain 116 turn working in the back bump of chain half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet each st to end turn 115 sts r2 ch1 do not count half_double_crochet same st as chain 1 half_double_crochet in each st to end turn r3 ch1 do not count half_double_crochet same st half_double_crochet each st to end cut yarn leaving a long tail for sewing on hanger i measure twice the length of the cover assembly sew ends together but do not fasten_off insert hook of hanger between two stitches close to the join fold cover over hanger and stitch closed on the inside of the hanger using whatever method you prefer i use whip stitch fasten_off and weave end optional sometimes i decorate my hangers at the base of the hook using crochet flowers hearts bows etc there are many free patterns online or do what i do and just make up your own ©copyright sherry l farley 2010 questions comments email mrsfarley1983@gmail com simple hanger cover
